Reason: The configuration option 'depths.refraction' in the 'sunflow' software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the rendering performance of the system. A higher value for 'depths.refraction' may result in more complex ray tracing calculations, leading to increased execution time and memory consumption during rendering. Conversely, a lower value may reduce the computational load but could also affect the quality of the rendered images. Therefore, any change in the 'depths.refraction' configuration can have a noticeable impact on system performance.
